citeinfo.title: Changes in Anthropogenic Influences on Streams and Rivers: Water Use, Freshwater Withdrawals

descript.abstract: This dataset consists of a table of mean freshwater withdrawals in units of millions of gallons per day per square kilometer for five-year periods from 1985 to 2010.
descript.purpose: These data are intended to provide a framework in which watershed-specific studies of water quality in streams and rivers may be analyzed. The focus of the data is on anthropogenic changes over time.
descript.supplinf: One comma-separated text file is given here. The file contains a "uniqid" field, which is the link to the data in all other datasets in this product. Each file has 15,458 rows. Data are most appropriate for broad-scale applications and calculations; original source data are from county-level values. Users should be cognizant of some potential issues in comparing water use over time: water use values may change for various reasons: counties may begin importing or exporting water, industries may open or close between years, or jurisdictional/political changes may occur. For example, a change may occur in how two adjacent counties are permitted to withdraw from a common river, potentially changing the numbers for each of them quite a bit in a time series. Some states may have changed the method by which they estimated water use for some uses over time, for example thermoelectric power. Users should be conservative in drawing conclusions about water use trends at fine spatial scales. HUC-10 boundaries were obtained on January 9, 2018 from the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) National Resources Conservation Service (NRCS) at https://nrcs.app.box.com/v/huc/folder/39640323180 (National Resources Conservation Service, 2017). References: Falcone, J.A., 2016, County fresh-water withdrawal water use allocated to relevant land uses in the United States: 1985 to 2010: U.S. Geological Survey data release, http://dx.doi.org/10.5066/F7DJ5CR5. National Resources Conservation Service, 2017, Watershed boundary dataset (WBD): National Resources Conservation Service, U.S. Department of Agriculture, available at https://www.nrcs.usda.gov/wps/portal/nrcs/main/national/technical/nra/geo/, accessed January 9, 2018 from https://nrcs.app.box.com/v/huc/folder/39640323180.

srcinfo.srccontr: HUC-10 boundaries used in data calculations.

citeinfo.title: County fresh-water withdrawal water use allocated to relevant land uses in the United States: 1985 to 2010

srcinfo.srccontr: Source data from which water use data were derived

procstep.procdesc: (1) Source data were taken from Falcone, 2016 at http://dx.doi.org/10.5066/F7DJ5CR5. These consist of six national rasters representing freshwater withdrawals in units of millions of gallons per day per square kilometer, for the six time periods 1985, 1990, 1995, 2000, 2005, and 2010. The data represent county water use statistics allocated to land use pixels: see Falcone 2016 for details.
(2) HUC-10 watershed averages of freshwater withdrawals in millions of gallons per day per square kilometer were calculated using the zonalmean() command in ArcGIS Grid.

enttyp.enttypl: Attribute Table for Water Use data
